thread.title: Report: MSU found Thompson's replacement: Jason Dietrich
thread.title_full: Report: MSU found Thompson's replacement: Jason Dietrich

title: Report: MSU found Thompson's replacement: Jason Dietrich
text:
Report: MSU found Thompson's replacement: Jason Dietrich Michael Bonner, The Clarion-Ledger 12:55 a.m. CDT October 23, 2015 Buy Photo Mississippi State University head baseball coach John Cohen talks to the media prior to the Bulldogs' game against USM at Trustmark Park in Pearl on March 24, 2015. Photo by Keith Warren (Photo: Keith Warren, Keith) Buy Photo 2 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
STARKVILLE -- Mississippi State may have found a replacement for Butch Thompson just hours after the former pitching coach departed for Auburn. 
According to College Baseball Daily, MSU has targeted Cal State Fullerton's Jason Dietrich to become the team's pitching coach. Dietrich's name was also mentioned by Division I Baseball. 
Dietrich has spent the last three seasons at Call State Fullerton. The Titans advanced to the College World Series last year built on a staff ERA of 2.89, which was the worse during his three-year tenure. 
Dietrich built his career on the west coast. Prior to Cal State Fullerton, he worked as the pitching coach for UC Irvine. He coached the Anteaters for five seasons. Prior to his stint in Irvine, Dietrich was the recruiting coordinator for UC Los Angeles, a Division II school. He also coached in the junior college ranks at Los Angeles City College. 
His only experience outside of the west coast came in 2004 and 2005 with the Hyannis Mets in the Cape Cod League. 
Dietrich would replace Thompson, who had been with MSU coach John Cohen since 2009. 
Contact Michael Bonner at mbonner@jackson.gannett.com. Follow @MikeBBonner on Twitter. Read or Share this story: http://on.thec-l.com/1LQIWp0 TOP VIDEOS
